Rules.Lighting Effects:
Lighting Effects

There are three levels of lighting that affect combat and exploration:

Areas of Light

  • All creatures can see normally with no penalties
  • Light sources: Flashlights, Lighters, Soul Weapons, street lamps, sunlight
  • Light Source Range: A light source provides its listed value of Light, then an additional equal amount of Shadows beyond that
    • - Example: Soul Weapon radiates 10ft Light + 10ft Shadows beyond (20ft+ = Darkness)
  • Stealth in Light: Cannot make Stealth Skill Checks unless there is Total Cover. Partial Cover = Disadvantage on Stealth
  • Spectral Outsiders have no natural aversion to Areas of Light or direct sunlight

    • Areas of Shadows

    Natural Areas of Shadows include:

  • Dim light sources (bright moon, dawn, dusk)
  • Areas between light sources

    • Effects:

  • Creatures without Sight Adjustment have Disadvantage on Attacks and Skill Checks that require visual clarity
  • Can make Stealth Skill Checks normally

    • Areas of Darkness

    Areas with no light whatsoever:

  • Heavily wooded areas at night
  • Indoor places with no lighting
  • Unlit alleyways at night

    • Effects:

  • Creatures without Sight Adjustment are considered to have the Disoriented Condition
  • A creature using Stealth is impossible to see but may still be heard

Rules.Sight Adjustments:
Sight Adjustments

Most Outsiders or Magi-Knights with Visors gain additional abilities to see in darkness or have different types of Sight. All Sight Adjustments have a default range of 120 feet unless otherwise noted.

Aethersight

A rare type of Sight Adjustment. Creatures with Aethersight see the world without the use of eyes and instead sense the world around them through the vibrations of ethereal energy.

  • Perfectly detect the movement of any creature on the ground
  • Detect even the slightest vibrations made in the air
  • Gain Advantage on Perception Skill Checks when rolling against someone attempting a Stealth Skill Check within range (if target moved during previous round)
  • Outsiders Only: Automatically detect Magi-Knights with 3+ Corruption Points (who automatically fail Stealth Skill Checks against them)

    • Clearsight

    Typically possessed by Spectral Outsiders. Allows complete viewing of the world without the need for any Light.

  • Treat all Darkness and Shadows as Areas of Light
  • See through illusions and invisibility
  • See through solid surfaces

    • Darksight

    Usually possessed by more "animalistic" Outsiders or Magi-Knights with Visors.

  • Ignore any penalties associated with Darkness and Shadows equal to the distance of your Darksight
  • Areas of Light do not interfere with Darksight

Soul Craving

The Outsider automatically detects the presence of any living creature within 60 feet, even through solid objects, and can perfectly see invisible or stealthy characters.

Stress and Exhaustion

Stress

  • Affects Mental rolls (INT, WIS, CHA)
  • Gained from difficult situations, social failures, Student Classes

  • At max with first overflow per day: Oppressive Stress → 1 Trauma

  • Affects Physical rolls (STR, DEX, CON)
  • Gained from physical strain, fighting Outsiders, Spell Modification
  • At max (6): Additional Exhaustion → Stress instead
  • At max (both): Additional point → 1 Trauma

Rules.Crystalline Fractures:
Crystalline Fractures

Soul Crystal has 7 Facets. 8th Fracture = Death.

Gaining Fractures

  • Reduced to 0 or negative HP
  • Malicious enemy attacks while Exposed/Unconscious
  • Invoking Heroic Conviction

    • Repairing Fractures

  • Sleep Phase recovery
  • High-tier Curing magic
  • Crystalline Suture
  • Rare sources

    • Exposed Condition

    Trigger: 0 HP with 5 or fewer Fractures, no Heroic Conviction

    Effect: Only Free Actions. Speech only 5ft, difficult to hear.

    Unconscious Condition

    Trigger: 0 HP with 6+ Fractures

    Effect: Completely defenseless, cannot act.

    Heroic Conviction

    Trigger: Reduced to 0 HP

    Cost: 1 additional Crystalline Fracture

    Effect: Regain 1 HP, remain conscious. Not Exposed/Unconscious.

Rules.Behavioral Traits:
Behavioral Traits

Aloof

An Aloof creature will do its best to merely observe enemies within a 60-foot distance. It prefers to pace around the battlefield, dealing no damage and taking the Standard and Bonus Actions: Unnerving Observation, which grants Disadvantage to one target's next attack or Spell Attack Roll. This trait is removed once the creature has been subject to an attack.

Apex Predator

The creature gains an additional turn at the end of the round. Specific Apex Predator abilities may require using the Standard Action for a particular ability.

Calculating

The creature spends its first turn watching the battle unfold and taking no Actions. During its second turn, it takes Two Move Actions, Two Standard Actions, and Two Bonus Actions (if it has any). It gains Advantage on all of its Attack Actions if it was not attacked during the previous turn.

Cautious

A Cautious creature prefers to keep as much distance as possible between themselves and their enemies. While attacking, they will constantly move to the very limits of their effective combat range, if doing so would not Provoke.

Cruel and Hateful

This creature has no qualms about making Attacks against Exposed or Unconscious Magi-Knights, inflicting further Crystalline Fractures. If the creature is within 10 feet of an Exposed or Unconscious target and no other enemies are within 10 feet, it will make its Attacks against the defenseless target.

Degrader

If a Degrader is within its Move range of an Exposed or Unconscious target, it prefers to take the Full-Round Action: Degradate. It moves towards them, makes an infuriating taunt, and then inflicts 6 Stress Points on its target. Additionally, the target must succeed on a Roll to Resist (Purity; 1 Trauma; DC 18 to Resist 1). This can only be done once per target.

Ferocious

After having its HP reduced by 1/2, a Ferocious creature fights even harder. After rolling for damage, it changes the lowest die of damage to its maximum face value. A Horde instead counts its Attacks and Damage as if they had one additional Unit remaining.

Haunting

When a Haunting creature dies, its slayer is afflicted with the Haunted Effect, which the Magic Keeper reveals during the next Sleep Phase. At that time, the target is assailed with horrifying dreams, night sweats, and overwhelmed with spine-chilling delusions. This afflicts them with the Feverish Dreams Effect during their Sleep Phase, but also negates the ability to recover Crystalline Fractures, Exhaustion, or Stress Points and inflicts 2 Exhaustion and 2 Stress Points.

Pack Hunter

Pack Hunters are Hordes that prefer to only hunt with others of their kind. If a Pack Hunter's Horde would be reduced to 1 Unit, it flees from combat.

Predator

A Predator prioritizes specific targets based on criteria listed in parentheses.

Predator TypeTarget Priority
Predator (Lowest Strength)Targets the creature with lowest STR
Predator (Highest HP)Targets the creature with highest HP
Predator (Most Corruption)Targets the creature with most Corruption Points
Predator (Most Trauma)Targets the creature with most Trauma Points
Predator (Longest Hair)Targets the creature with the longest hair
Predator (Chronomancers)Targets creatures using Chronomancy magic

Self-Preservation

A creature with Self-Preservation flees from combat once it has only ¼ of its HP remaining or the Horde has only one Unit remaining.

Stalker

A Stalker is a master of Stealth and waits for the perfect opportunity to strike. A Stalker is unable to be detected by normal means and requires a successful Purity Skill Check to detect its presence.

Rules.Defensive Traits:
Defensive Traits

Enduring

This Horde always counts as having 3 Units for the purposes of calculating its Attacks and Damage, if it would be reduced to 2 or fewer Units.

Resilient (Physical Resistance)

The creature has Physical Resistance, reducing all Physical damage received by 1/2.

Retaliatory

This creature is specially trained to take advantage of openings in combat. When it is the target of a missed Attack Action, it immediately deals the listed damage to them if they are within 60 ft. The Magic Keeper decides if this damage is Physical or Magical Damage.

Example: Retaliatory (10) deals 10 damage on a missed attack.

Shroud (Magic Resistance)

The creature has Magic Resistance, reducing all Magical damage received by 1/2.

---
Rules.Special Traits:
Special Traits

Accumulator

This Outsider cannot Attune Victims and instead gathers energy from special areas on the Cardinal Plane to assist in creating Spectral Structures. It can detect magical objects or locations.

Architect

This Outsider possesses the unique ability to construct Ethereal Anchors and Spectral Tethers, which allows it and others to remain in the Cardinal Plane if it completes the construction of these objects.

Attune Victim

With a varying amount of time and uninterrupted focus, a servant of the Invading Evil can temporarily change an Unconscious victim's Soul Alignment to match that of Elsewhere's as a Free Action. Afterward, the victim can be taken into Elsewhere when the Ethereal Bridge aligns. This ability has no effect on a Magi-Knight, as their Soul Alignment is tied to their Soul Crystal and that to the Herald.

Blood Hunter

A Blood Hunter is relentlessly drawn to wounded prey. When a Blood Hunter deals damage to a target, that target gains the Hunted Condition for the rest of the Encounter. While Hunted:

  • The Blood Hunter can sense the target's location within 1 mile
  • The Blood Hunter gains Advantage on attacks against the Hunted target
  • If the Hunted target attempts to flee, the Blood Hunter may use its Reaction to immediately Move up to its full speed toward the target
  • The Blood Hunter prioritizes Hunted targets over all others

Bonded Horde / Bonded Spawn

The Horde always splits all damage it receives as evenly as possible between all Units.

Colossal Impact

The creature's attacks affect large areas due to its massive size, potentially hitting multiple targets or causing environmental damage.

Eyeless

The Outsider has no eyes and loses Clearsight. Instead, it has Aethersight 60 ft.

Flawed Vision

The Outsider has weakened senses and loses Clearsight. Instead, it has Darksight 120 ft.

Horrific Outsider

During a Combat Encounter, Magi-Knights must Roll to Resist (Horror) with DC equal to this creature's Horrific Rating, rolling 1d100.

Magical Being

All Outsiders can Climb and Jump up to their Move but must end their turn in an empty space after committing to this Move.

Native to Elsewhere

This creature only appears on the Cardinal Plane (Earth) during certain hours. If it lingers in the Cardinal Plane outside of the Ethereal Bridge's time frame, it is forced back into Elsewhere (taking d100 damage upon its return). This is ignored if they are within 800 meters (1/2 mile) of a Spectral Tether.

One Resistance

All Outsiders have either the Shroud Trait (Magic Resistance) or Ethereal Trait (Physical Resistance).

Soul Drinker

The creature heals HP with every Primary or Secondary Attack against a target. The number in parentheses indicates the HP healed. Alternatively, if the creature is already at full health, it may immediately make another Primary Attack against a target within range.

Example: Soul Drinker (4) heals 4 HP per attack.

Spectral Touch

When attacking a Mortal (that is not a Magi-Knight), an Outsider only needs to hit a target of 12. If successful, their attack renders the target Unconscious. When attacking the Student Persona of a Magi-Knight who is not transformed, the attack inflicts 2 Crystalline Fractures on a success instead of dealing normal damage.

Swarm

The Swarm moves, attacks, and deals damage as a single creature, but takes up as much space as a single Huge creature that does not have Reach. Due to the sheer number of creatures within a Swarm, they are considered Immune to All Conditions.

Yawning Portal / Yawning Veil

These dimensional traits allow the creature to create or use portals between the Cardinal Plane and Elsewhere, or to disguise its true nature behind a veil of normalcy.

Rules.Enemy Restriction System [R]:
Enemy Restriction System [R]

Some enemy abilities are marked with [R] to indicate they are Restricted. Restricted abilities are locked and cannot be used until specific criteria are met during combat.

Common Restriction Triggers:

  • HP reduced to a threshold (e.g., 1/2 HP, specific HP value)
  • A Magi-Knight becomes Exposed or Unconscious
  • A specific number of turns have passed
  • The creature successfully hits with a particular attack
  • An ally is defeated
Once a Restriction is removed, the ability becomes available for the remainder of the Combat Encounter unless otherwise specified.

Horde

A Horde consists of multiple Units (typically 4) that function as a single creature on the battlefield.

  • Hordes have HP listed for each Unit (e.g., 30 / 30 / 30 / 30)
  • Attack bonuses and damage decrease as Units are defeated
  • Some Hordes have special abilities that trigger when reduced to fewer Units

    • Swarm

    A Swarm represents a massive number of small creatures that cannot be individually targeted.

  • Takes up space equal to a Huge creature without Reach
  • Immune to All Conditions
  • Typically has unique abilities related to overwhelming numbers

Rules.A:
A

Act of Remorse: An act done by a penitent Magi-Knight to facilitate the removal of accumulated Corruption Points.

Actions: The term for any action taken, typically during Combat Encounters such as: Move, Standard, Bonus, Full-Round, Reaction, etc.

Advantage: Forcing a target to roll 2d20 and pick the highest die rolled between the two as their result.

Adversary: A powerful enemy who serves a Nemesis and tries to prevent the squadron from disrupting their master's plot.

Armament Runes: Armor, Attachments, and Weapon Runes that are placed onto Armaments to increase their power.

Armor: The target number that an enemy must roll to determine if they deal damage to their total Hit Points. Determined by rolling a 1d20 and adding your Attack Modifier.

Astral Weave: An incredibly rare weave made from cosmic materials that can be woven into Soul Armor. Cannot be created or purchased.

Attack Bonus: The modifier that is added to your total when you attack with a weapon or unarmed attack. Determined by your Proficiency Bonus and your Strength, or Dexterity if a Soul Weapon has the Finesse Quality.

Awakening: Lore: When a PC/NPC is determined to be a worthy Magi-Knight candidate and receives their powers.

---
Rules.B:
B

Battle Technique: A special technique which grants a unique ability to a Magi-Knight. Gained by leveling.

Bond Ability: An ability given to a player when they have reached the threshold of a Bond Level.

Bond Level: An approximation of the strength of a bond and what abilities come from forging that close relationship.

Budget Tallies: An approximation of your spending ability. The tallies are used to purchase items of various quality from the Gear section and can even be used to bribe NPCs.

Burnout: What happens after a Total Soul Eclipse. Ultimately reduces the length of a Magi-Knight's Soul Eclipse Chart.

---
Rules.C:
C

Combat Forms: A set of various fighting forms that Magi-Knights learn to help them gain additional abilities in combat.

Combination Maneuvers: Also referred to as "Combos," these powerful moves are coordinated with other teammates.

Conditions (Various): A Condition can affect a target and may debilitate them or inflict a type of penalty.

Corruption Points: An approximation of the Corruption in a Magi-Knight's heart when they cause the suffering of others.

Court Card of Fate: A singular person who has had a significant impact on your life, also referred to as Court Card or Fate Card.

Creature Trait: A special trait given to a creature that alters its normal behavior in combat or grants it additional effects.

Critical Hits and Fails: This occurs when you would roll a Natural 20 or Natural 1 on your d20 roll and counts towards all d20 rolls. It can increase your damage dealt or guarantee success.

Critical Hits (Enemies): Enemies do not deal additional damage with Critical Hits and instead the target gains the Distressed Condition.

Crystalline Fracture: An estimation of a Magi-Knight's remaining strength before falling in combat and dying. A Magi-Knight can take up to 7 Crystalline Fractures before an additional one would permanently kill them.

Cultist: A mortal human who pledged themselves to the Invading Evil in exchange for an unknown desire.

---
Rules.D:
D

Damage Type: The type of damage dealt by an action. Weapons typically deal Physical Damage while magic deals Magical Damage. Rare abilities can cause True Damage.

Damage Type (Immune): When a target has immunity to a type of damage, they reduce either the Physical or Magical damage received to 0.

Damage Type (Resistance): When a target has resistance to a type of damage, they reduce either the Physical or Magical damage received by 1/2.

Damage Type (True): True Damage bypasses the immunities and resistances of a target, automatically dealing its total value in damage.

Desired Object: An item chosen by the player to purchase using Budget Tallies. Can help complete tasks or grant bonus modifiers.

Difficulty Check: The target number that a Skill Check, Roll to Resist, or other die roll must meet or exceed in order to be considered successful.

Disadvantage: Forcing a target to roll 2d20 and pick the lowest die rolled between the two as their result.

Dynamic Objects: Created at the beginning of a Combat Encounter, these objects can be used by players to add a bonus to their Actions and are used as a Free Action.

Dynamic Scenario: A scenario in which additional issues must be dealt with while dealing with a standard Combat Encounter.

---
Rules.E:
E

Elemental Affinity: The Element that is tied to a Magi-Knight and dictates their Armor, Enhancements, and Roll to Resist Proficiency.

Elemental Enhancement: Chosen after selecting an Elemental Affinity, this choice gives a permanent adjustment and determines Roll to Resist Proficiency. Bonuses granted are added to the total and are not multiplicative.

Elemental Skill: The Skill that you receive Mastery in at Character Creation that relates to your Student Skills or Court Card.

Elsewhere: Lore: The undiscovered but theoretical home realm of all Outsiders.

Encounter (Combat/Social): An encounter in which the Magi-Knights must resolve the issue using either Combat or Social abilities, or both!

Encounter (Chase): An encounter in which the Magi-Knights must flee or pursue a target, using multiple Skill Checks to determine the outcome.

Endurance Die: The d6 rolled to see if a player can mitigate the effects of their Exhaustion or Stress Points during a roll. The die must equal or exceed the total points possessed to be successful.

ESKIA: An acronym meaning "Entire Squadron Killed in Action," and refers to all Magi-Knights within the squadron dying during a single Encounter.

Ethereal Bridge: Lore: The figurative "bridge" that Outsiders use to travel from their realm to the world and then back again.

Exhaustion Points: An approximation of a player's physical exhaustion and a measure of how far they can push their body. Affects physical activities such as Attacking with Soul Weapons.

Herald: An otherworldly being that has come to Earth to turn a select few personages into Magi-Knights; controlled by the Magic Keeper.

Herald's Array: A set of pre-generated numbers that are used to create a character or New-Rice Magi-Knight.

HIRU - "Hey, I Remember You": A d100 roll that is made to determine if your character might know a random NPC.

Hit Points (HP): An estimation of a Magi-Knight's potential to take damage before taking Crystalline Fractures.

Hit Points (Temporary): A shield or barrier that prevents damage being directly dealt to a target's HP. Temp HP must be reduced first and does not count towards your "Maximum" or "Total" HP and cannot be healed, only replaced.

Horde: A group of enemies that attack simultaneously and represent a large number of enemies. Typically consists of 4 "Parts" or "Units".

Rules.I:
I

Inert Spectral Energy: The negative energy left behind by Cultists and Outsiders when defeated, which are gathered into Gloom Gems.

Inert Spectral Energy Rating: An approximation of the strength of negative energy left behind by the Invading Evil, after being defeated.

Initiative: The turn order in a Combat Encounter, determined by a 1d20 die roll that adds your Dexterity to the total.

Inspiration Point: A type of point that allows you to use Student Abilities, Combos, Reroll Dice, and other things.

Invading Evil: Lore: The collective forces of evil that are attacking Lapis City and abducting its citizens.

Invasion Level: The strength of Outsiders that are sent to fight Magi-Knights. Typically matches the Squadron's Reputation Level, and almost never should an enemy be sent against them that is higher level than this.

Rules.L:
L

Lapis City: Lore: The canonical city in which Magi-Knights Awakening takes place.

Lazuli Region: Lore: The canonical region in which Magi-Knights Awakening takes place.

Lethal Damage: Damage dealt to a Magi-Squire that exceeds 10 + double the level of the Squire.

Lethal Weapon: A type of weapon that if used during a Combat Encounter, can actually kill a mortal and negates a portion of Student Armor.

Lighting: There are three types of Areas of Lighting: Darkness, Shadows, and Light. Refer to the "Lighting Effects" in the Combat chapter for further clarification.

Lunar Blip: The circle connected to the moon phase on the character sheet and used to keep track of Corruption and Trauma Points.

Lunchtime Activity: The period of time after the School AM Phase but before the School PM Phase in which the players choose a short activity before classes start again.

---
Rules.M:
M

Magi-Knight: Lore: A character who was granted a second chance at life by the Herald in exchange for fighting against the Invading Evil.

Magi-Squire: An NPC that is created to assist Magi-Knight squadron's who have less than 5 total players within their group.

Magic Ability Modifier (MAM): The statistic that you use to cast Magic, determine Mana Points, Roll to Resist (Magic), and other magical abilities.

Magic Keeper: AKA the "Game Master." The person who narrates the game for the players, roleplays Magi-Squires, controls the Herald, and enemies of the game.

Magic Style: The category of Magic that a Magi-Knight uses to cast their magic; such as Ethereal, Memento, Shaper, Soul, Verse, and others. Dictates what Spell Paths are available for you to cast.

Magical Implement: An alternate choice to the traditional Soul Weapon which channels greater mana power and magical defenses.

Mana Coefficient: Used to calculate a Magi-Knight's total MP. Determined by adding their level, MAM, and Reputation Level together.

Mana Points (MP): An estimation of a Magi-Knight's potential to cast spells.

Modified Spell: Modifying a spell by taking a penalty to adjust the strength, speed, or reduce its cost.

Modified Spell (Mana Strain): Taking an Exhaustion Point to reduce the Mana Cost of a spell.

Modified Spell (Overcharging): Taking 2 Exhaustion Points to increase the power of a spell and adding dice to its total effects.

Modified Spell (Rushed Spell): Casting a spell more quickly at the cost of efficiency, while maintaining its total Mana Cost.

Moment of Solace: The period of time that occurs in-between multiple Combat Encounters that allows Magi-Knights a brief moment to recuperate.

Move: The total number of feet that your character can move on a battle grid. Divide this number by 5 to determine squares of Move.

---
Rules.N:
N

Nemesis: An incredibly strong enemy and often the final boss of an Episode, but not as strong as a Harbinger.

New Rice: The friendly title given to a brand new Magi-Knight in need of training. It references the Japanese kanji for "新" (New) and "米" (a husked grain of rice) which has not yet been polished or milled. The kanji together have the meaning of "Novice."

---
Rules.O:
O

Observing Fate's Influence: The process by which the players collectively create a group of Statistics to tie to their Characteristics.

On-Target/Off-Target: Specifically used for Explosion magic to determine the accuracy of their blast and determine their damage.

Oppressive Stress: The first time each day when you would gain a Stress Point but already have 6 Stress (maximum), you instead gain 1 Trauma Point. Unlocks the ability to Freak Out!

---
Rules.P:
P

Persona (Magi-Knight): The player character after transforming. Typically can only be used when confronting The Invading Evil.

Persona (Student): The player character during the day, when they are living their day-to-day lives and are unable to transform into Magi-Knights.

Phase (Game): The period of time in a single day which is broken down into the School, Free Time, Investigation, Patrol, and Sleep Phases.

Phase (Free Time): A period of time when players have free time during the day to reduce Stress, increase Social Points, and other things.

Phase (Investigation): A period of time when players scout various areas trying to learn of Cultist or Outsider activity.

Phase (School: AM & PM): The period of time when players attend school and make Student Class Checks to gauge their academic outcomes for the day.

Phase (Sleep): The period of time when players sleep and try to recuperate their Exhaustion, Stress, HP, MP, and other resources.

Phases (Story): An extended period of time broken down into: Phases (Days), Episodes, Seasons, and Sagas.

Player Link: A Link that connects the player to another player or NPC and can be tied to their background story. Chosen during Character Creation.

Player Link Reward: A reward such as additional Social Points, an ability, and a Shard Reward gained from the Player Link chosen.

Proficiency Bonus: The bonus that is added to Skills and Attacks, which increases as you gain Levels.

Provoking (an Attack): The ability for a nearby, hostile target to attack you if you would move away from them without using the Withdraw Action. Requires the use of a Reaction to activate.

---
Rules.R:
R

Relic: A rare and powerful object that can only be discovered. Can be broken down for Gloom Gems or has a myriad of unknown uses. Typically discovered in the hands of the Invading Evil or sometimes lost to time but hiding in plain sight.

Reputation Level: An approximation of the squadron's Reputation which increases their abilities and scales with their Level.

Roll to Resist: A roll made by a player to resist negative effects, such as enemy magic, gaining Trauma, or others.

---
Rules.S:
S

Shard of Power: A Shard created by the Herald which can grant one-time effects and benefits to Magi-Knights. Consumed upon use.

Skills: A group of skills that approximate which one should be used to determine if a player can pass a Skill Check.

Skill Check: Called for by the Magic Keeper, this check can determine whether a player is successful or not in completing a task.

Skill Check (Expert): A Skill Check that is made with one player rolling a d20 and at least one other member being able to assist them by adding their modifier.

Skill Check (Multi-Skill): A complex task in which multiple Skill Checks are required to complete the objective; usually in a Combat Encounter.

Skill Check (Opposed): A Skill Check that is made with one player rolling a d20 and measuring their roll against an opponent's d20 roll.

Skill Check (Solo): A Skill Check that is made with one player rolling a d20 but wherein no other player can add modifiers.

Skill Check (Squadron): A Skill Check made by the entire squadron to gauge their success. Used by rolling 5d4s and adding modifiers.

Skill Mastery: A Skill that you had Proficiency in, but are now considered to have Mastery of. You add your Reputation Level to it.

Skill Proficiency: A Skill that you are considered Proficient in, which allows you to gain benefits in addition to the Proficiency Bonus.

Sight Adjustments: Most Outsiders or Magi-Knights with Visors gain additional abilities to see in darkness or have different types of Sight.

Social Points: An estimation of the strength of a player's social bond with both other Magi-Knights and NPCs.

Soul Armaments: The weapons and armor of a Magi-Knight and the only thing that can harm Outsiders or offer protection against them.

Soul Crystal: The magical object that allows a Magi-Knight to transform, and shatters when they would die.

Soul Eclipse Chart: The chart on a character sheet which constitutes Lunar Phases, Lunar Blips, and keeps track of Burnout, Corruption, and Trauma.

Soul Oblation (Heroic Sacrifice): A powerful ability used by Magi-Knights in which they sacrifice their lives for an incredible burst of power.

Soul Sacrifice: An ability used by Magi-Knights experiencing a Burnout to protect themselves. Requires the permanent sacrifice of Statistics.

Spectral Outsider: A monstrous creature from Elsewhere that abducts unfortunate mortals.

Spectral Script/Tongue: Lore: The script and language of Outsiders. Clumsily spoken by Cultists, it can cause madness and Corruption to those that read or speak it.

Spectral Tether: A powerful object that allows Outsiders to remain in the world during the day and exercise their powers freely.

Spell Attack: The modifier that is added to your total when you attack with a spell.

Spell DC (Difficulty Check): The number that a target must roll to see if they resist the effects of your magic using a Roll to Resist.

Spell Intensity Tax: The taxing effect of casting powerful magic. The caster takes Exhaustion Point(s) in addition to paying its MP cost.

Spell Path: The category of Magic that a Magi-Knight chooses to specialize in such as Beam, Curing, or Summoning.

Spell Path (Mastery): The dedication of multiple Spell Path choices into a single choice to gain Rank Titles and increased effects (Chronomancy Only).

Spell Tiers: The strength of a spell that can be cast. Gained by increasing Levels and broken down into Tier I through Tier VI.

Squadron Leader: Collectively voted by the squadron to gain the Leadership Die during an Episode.

Statistic: The term for any of the 6 characteristics of a player: Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma.

Stress Points: An approximation of a player's stress when dealing with difficult, but non-traumatic events. Decreases Mental faculties.

Student Ability: The special ability received by every player after they have selected their Student Type.

Student Type: A classification of your human persona that grants you your Starting Skills and Student Abilities.

Studied (Effect): This effect grants a bonus on Student Classes or in a Combat Encounter.

Success at a Cost: The outcome of a "failed" Skill Check in which the player attains the original goal, but at the cost of something else.

Swarm: A tremendous number of enemies whose size on the battlefield does not dwindle until they are completely defeated.

---
Rules.T:
T

Tactic (Combat/Social): A unique ability used by a Magi-Knight during a Combat or Social Encounter; depending on the type of Tactic chosen.

Tactical Formation: A formation that can be entered into by the squadron to provide all of them with special benefits in combat.

Total Focus: The ability to focus on a spell to make its effects persist after casting it. Lost when gaining certain Conditions.

Total Soul Eclipse: What occurs when a player has no more Lunar Blips to fill in on their Soul Eclipse Chart. This leads to Burnout.

Trauma: A difficult experience endured but not forgotten, such as being abducted by an Outsider, experiencing a natural disaster, or seeing death. Quickly accumulated by Magi-Knights.

Trauma (Devastating): Receiving a massive amount of Trauma Points from a single source (3 or more). Inflicts Condition penalties on the target.

Trauma Points: The accumulation of difficult experiences which can cause a Magi-Knight to experience a Burnout.

Transformation: When a Magi-Knight changes from their Student Persona into their Magi-Knight Persona.

Transformation (Forced): When a player forces themselves to transform when there is no presence of evil. Inflicts 3 Fractures.

Rules.U:
U

Unity Points: Unity is used by Magi-Knights to pay for the cost of Combination Maneuvers.

---
Rules.V:
V

Variant: A special formula used to modify a creature's stat block, and not included in this book.

Vassal: A weak but plentiful enemy that serves both the Adversary and the Nemesis. They will try to slow down a squadron's progress.

Veteran Magi-Knight: Lore: A Magi-Knight who has already had a plethora of experience fighting against the Invading Evil. A player might be called this after they have achieved Level 10+.

Effect: Choose one target. Your first successful Weapon Attack each Round against that target gains +1d6 damage. When the target dies, recover 2 Stress Points and 1 Exhaustion Point.

Knight's Resolution (9th+)

Level: 9+ Frequency: Once per Combat Encounter Action: Immediate Action

Leadership [Talented].name: Leadership [Talented]
Leadership [Talented].description:
Leadership [Talented]

Level: 3+ Prerequisite: Proficiency in Leadership Skill Frequency: Once per Sleep Phase Action: Standard Action

Effect: During Combat Encounter, give Temp HP to all squadron members within 30 feet equal to:

  • Leadership Skill modifier
  • + Reputation Level (min 0)
  • + Leadership Die roll (if Squadron Leader)
Any Exposed Magi-Knight receiving this effect also recovers 1 HP.

Exceptional Leadership (9th+)

Requires: Leadership [Talented] Frequency: Once per Encounter

Effect: While using Talented Leadership, attempt to remove Distressed or Horrified Condition from one squadmate. Make Leadership Check with Advantage.

---

Magical Augmentation.name: Magical Augmentation
Magical Augmentation.description:
Magical Augmentation

Level: 3+ Frequency: Once per Turn

Effect: You have Magical Augmentation Dice (d8s) equal to your Proficiency Bonus. When a Magi-Knight you can see is about to attempt a Skill Check, Attack Roll, Damage Roll (single target), Healing Roll (single target), or Roll to Resist, roll an Augmentation Die and add it to the total.

Dice pool replenishes after Sleep Phase.

Overpowering Surge.name: Overpowering Surge
Overpowering Surge.description:
Overpowering Surge

Level: 3+ Frequency: Once per Sleep Phase Action: Full-Round Action

Effect: Make a Spell Attack with Advantage.

Single Target: Add d12s equal to ½ Reputation Level (rounded down, min 1) to damage.

Multiple Targets: Add d6s equal to ½ Reputation Level (rounded down, min 1) to damage.

Perfect Parry (6th+).name: Perfect Parry (6th+)
Perfect Parry (6th+).description:
Perfect Parry (6th+)

Level: 6+ Frequency: Once per Round Action: Immediate Action

Trigger: When you take Physical Damage from an enemy

Effect: Reduce the damage by 1d12 + Magi-Knight Level + Reputation Level (min 1).

Perfect Riposte (9th+)

Requires: Perfect Parry Action: Reaction

Effect: If you reduce Physical damage to 0 with Perfect Parry, immediately deal your Weapon Damage to the attacker + your Magi-Knight Level.

---

Scathing Retort.name: Scathing Retort
Scathing Retort.description:
Scathing Retort

Level: 3+ Frequency: Once per Combat Encounter Action: Reaction

Trigger: Any Action taken by an enemy within 60 feet

Effect: Roll 1d10. Choose one: reduce enemy's next Attack, Damage, or Roll to Resist total by the result. Must declare before results are revealed.

---

Sidestep.name: Sidestep
Sidestep.description:
Sidestep

Level: 3+ Frequency: Once per Encounter Action: Reaction

Trigger: Taking an Attack

Effect: Reduce the damage by ½, ignore any Conditions from the attack, then Teleport 15 feet.

Sidestep [Improved] (6th+)

Requires: Sidestep

Effect: After using Sidestep, Teleport directly behind your target and make an immediate Weapon Attack against them.

Soul Crystal [Illumination].name: Soul Crystal [Illumination]
Soul Crystal [Illumination].description:
Soul Crystal [Illumination]

Level: 3+ Frequency: Once per Combat Encounter Action: Full-Round Action

Effect: Expel blinding light. All enemies within 20 feet must Roll to Resist (Magic) against your Spell DC. On failure, gain Disoriented Condition until end of your next turn.

Immunity: Nemesis Rank or stronger are immune.

Bonus: While using Beacons of Light ability, double the amount of Light your weapon generates.

Soul Crystal [Purification] (6th+)

Requires: Soul Crystal [Illumination] Frequency: Once per Sleep Phase Action: Bonus Action

Effect: Make a Roll to Resist against up to three active Conditions affecting you or squadmates within your Beacons of Light ability. On success, remove the Condition as if affected by Cleanse (1).

Squadron Formation Mastery (6th+)

Disciplined Agility

Divine Tailor

  • Full-Round Action: Turn a Reversed Card Upright

Elemental Bulwark

---

Elemental Curing

Frequency: Once per Round

Trigger: When restoring HP to any other target with a spell

Effect: Reroll one die that was just rolled.

Alternative: Instead of rerolling, pay additional ½ MP cost (rounded up) to change all dice to maximum value.

---
Techniques.Elemental Relocation:
Elemental Relocation

Trigger: After being hit by a Physical Attack and resolving damage/effects

Condition: You are not afflicted with a Condition

Effect: Teleport 5 feet away.

---
Techniques.Endless Resolve:
Endless Resolve

Effect:

  • The first time you would gain a Stress Point after Sleep Phase, reduce the total by 1
  • Once per Sleep Phase: Reduce Stress Points by 3 but gain 1 Exhaustion Point
---
Techniques.Enduring Mindset (Combat):
Enduring Mindset (Combat)

Frequency: Once per Combat Encounter

Trigger: You or ally within 60 feet fail Exhaustion Die roll

Action: Immediate Action

Effect: Change the Endurance Die result to a 6.

---
Techniques.Implement Mastery:
Implement Mastery

Trigger: When making a Weapon Attack with your Magical Implement

Effect: Add your MAM to both your Attack and Damage in addition to any other modifiers.

---

Intensify Element

Prerequisite: Summoning Spell Path (no effect on Companions) Note: If you gain Enhanced Summoning, this Tactic is refunded

Effect: Replace your Elemental Summon's Special Ability with one of the following:

ElementEffect

Earth (Entangling)Hostile creature moving away has Move reduced by ½; Summon attacks with Advantage
Wind (Elusive)Summon never Provokes; 1/Round deal MAM + Rep Level Magical Damage to target moved away from

Techniques.Magical Foresight:
Magical Foresight

Effect:

  • Add your MAM to your Dexterity Modifier when rolling Initiative
  • Attacks made against you during an Ambush do not gain Advantage
  • If another ability already adds MAM to Initiative, you may add it a second time
---
Techniques.Martial Artist:
Martial Artist

Effect:

  • Unarmed Damage Die and Student Damage Die become 1d6 (instead of 1d4)
  • Choose Dexterity OR Strength Modifier for Unarmed Damage
  • Perform Unarmed Attack as a Bonus Action
  • Unarmed Attacks gain Weapon Quality: Staggering Blow
---
Techniques.Quicksword Technique:
Quicksword Technique

Effect:

  • After making a Weapon Attack against a target, you no longer Provoke Attacks from them for the remainder of your turn
  • After making a Weapon Attack, you may Move 10 feet
---
Techniques.Refocused Control:
Refocused Control

Trigger: When a Horde or Vassal enemy succeeds on Roll to Resist against your Spell

Action: Reaction

Effect: Force them to reroll that die again.

---
Techniques.Reinforced Connection:
Reinforced Connection

Prerequisite: Enhanced Summon: Companion Spell Path

Effect:

  • Your Companion's True Soul-Link now also adds your Magi-Knight Level to the total
  • Extends your Range of Influence by an additional 30 feet
---
Techniques.Resilient Soul Crystal:
Resilient Soul Crystal

Limit: Can only take this Tactic once

Effect: Choose one:

  • Add +1 to a Statistic of your choice AND gain proficiency with one Roll to Resist: Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution
  • OR gain proficiency with Rolls to Resist: Magic (instead of stat/resistance proficiency)
---

Shield of the Guardian

Prerequisite: Wielding a Knight's Force Shield

Trigger: You or an adjacent ally are affected by Physical Damage

Action: Reaction

Effect: Reduce damage to you or your ally by 3 + your Reputation Level (min 0). Applied before other reduction effects.

---
Techniques.Shoulder to the Wheel:
Shoulder to the Wheel

Effect:

  • The first time you would gain an Exhaustion Point after Sleep Phase, reduce the total by 1
  • Once per Sleep Phase: Reduce Exhaustion Points by 1 but gain 2 Stress Points
---
Techniques.Single-Minded Focus:
Single-Minded Focus

Effect: Your Total Focus is now only lost when you become Horrified or Unconscious (instead of Distressed).

---
Techniques.Telepathic Summoner:
Telepathic Summoner

Prerequisite: Summoning or Enhanced Summoning Spell Path

Effect: Ignore any detrimental effects from the Silenced Condition that involve Issuing Commands. Maintain your Perfectly Synchronized ability.

---
Techniques.Tough as Nails:
Tough as Nails

Effect:

  • Gain +2 Student HP
  • Gain +2 HP per Magi-Knight Level while transformed
  • Points are retroactively received

A Meeting on the Other Side, a Record by.description:
A Meeting on the Other Side, a Record by Sirius Lee

This book and others like it are journals or records that have conveniently escaped the notice of a Herald, whose duty is to remove evidence of Magi-Knights, Outsiders, and Elsewhere from the Cardinal Realm.

This unassuming book was written by Sirius Lee, a globe-trotting American antiquarian who lived during the 1920s. The pages are extremely difficult to read, having no index, chapter labels, and hastily transcribed cursive written during moments of fervor. This black, leather-bound book seems more akin to a lengthy journal or memoir.

Acquisition: Sold by Yoona's grandfather for part-time work at the shop or 5 Budget Tallies.

Contents: Details "Visitors from Beyond," solid walls morphing into skin-like plasticity, horrible screeches, esoteric concepts of other worlds, alternate realities, and bridges to those places.

#### Reading the Book

  • The book can be read during a small window of downtime. Each time read, mark 1 Reading Tally next to it (maximum once per day).
  • New Free Time Activity - Read the Record: Each time read as a Free Time Activity, mark 4 Reading Tallies.
  • At 15 Reading Tallies, the record has been read in its entirety once. Erase all Reading Tallies.

    • #### Reading Completion Effects

    Complete 1st Reading:

  • The item becomes a Relic
  • Gain 2 Inspiration Points
  • Gain +1 Mysticism Bonus while possessing the record
  • Next Sleep Phase: Feverish Dreams Effect

    • Complete 2nd Reading:

  • Gain 2 Inspiration Points
  • Previous bonus becomes +2 Mysticism Bonus
  • Next two Sleep Phases: Feverish Dreams Effect

    • Complete 3rd Reading:

  • Gain 1 Inspiration Point and 2 Trauma Points
  • Previous bonus becomes +3 Mysticism Bonus
  • Become immune to Feverish Dreams Effect while possessing the book
  • Discover a hidden ritual written between the lines (Sirius Lee's Ritual)
  • Gain access to Free Time Activity: Sirius Lee's Ritual

    • #### Sirius Lee's Ritual

  • Involves drawing unknown symbols on a 20x20-foot area, plus a large arcane circle, and utterance of complex words by up to 5 people
  • Mysticism DC 20: Determines this is Spectral Script
  • Mysticism DC 25: Determines the words are Spectral Tongue (romanized)
  • Completing the Ritual: Mysticism Skill Check (DC 18)
- Failure: Can attempt again later with no ill effects - Success: Large explosion of energy from the arcane circle. The relic becomes an Indestructible Relic, then nothing else occurs. Record "Completed Sirius' Ritual" and whether you participated.

Destruction: The squadron can collectively decide to destroy this Relic but gain no Gloom Gems (unless it has become Indestructible).

Spiral Disc.name: Spiral Disc
Spiral Disc.description:
Spiral Disc

This Relic comes from an area of densely concentrated Inert Spectral Energy and forms when a previously destroyed Spectral Tether reopens slightly. Time has worn down the suture, and corruptive energy from Elsewhere seeps back through.

These discs can form from any solid object: stone, wood, minerals, or bone. They contain a piece of the cosmos within them and always display incredible vistas of nebulas and spiraling galaxies. Staring into one has both restorative and calming effects, granting brief moments of enlightenment and inspiration. However, it brings the viewer closer to the call of Elsewhere due to the Invading Evil's corruptive influence.

#### Effects

New Free Time Activity - Gaze Into the Disc: After gazing into the disc for an entire activity with no social interaction:

  • Reduce Exhaustion Points to 0
  • Reduce Stress Points to 0
  • Gain 1 Inspiration Point
  • Gain 1 Corruption Point
Destruction: The squadron can collectively decide to destroy this Relic. Each member gains 10 Gloom Gems.

---

Ring of Calling.name: Ring of Calling
Ring of Calling.description:
Ring of Calling

This ring is a type of magical communication device with similarities to a Magi-Knight's Long-Range Communicator. It uses a powerful psychic connection to summon the aspect of a creature it is connected to into the wearer's dreams - in deep sleep or even daydreams. Unlike standard communicators, the Ring of Calling allows the wearer and connected creature to convey emotions, thoughts, and sensations, even across different planes of existence.

#### Effects

  • Sleep Connection: While wearing this ring, whenever you sleep, you are psychically linked to its creator.
  • Ring Detection: After communion with its creator, the ring intermittently vibrates gently when other Rings of Calling (connected to the same Nemesis Outsider or Harbinger) are within 1-mile radius. It can pinpoint another ring within 50-foot radius.
  • Cannot Be Removed: Once put on, this ring cannot be voluntarily removed except:
    • - After connection established: A Herald or Magi-Knight who passes Mysticism DC 20 can remove it. This irrevocably destroys the ring and creates an area of Spectral Energy. - When the wearer loses mystical powers (Cultist defeat or Magi-Knight death)
  • Additional Properties: Rings attached to particularly powerful entities could have additional unlisted properties.
Destruction: The squadron can collectively decide to destroy this Relic. Each member gains 5 Gloom Gems.

---

Relic of Skill Improvement.name: Relic of Skill Improvement
Relic of Skill Improvement.description:
Relic of Skill Improvement

This Relic typically takes the form of a small crystal that attaches to its owner's Soul Crystal once acquired, remaining active even when not transformed. The design is relatively simple but origins vary greatly. This Relic is highly adaptable, with areas of improvement constantly fluctuating until a Herald focuses energy to stop the magic from shifting.

#### Skill Improvement Table

Upon receiving, roll 1d20 (cannot be modified). At the beginning of every Episode, reroll and change the Skill Improvement to match.

d20TypeBonus
1-9Relic of Skill SupportYour lowest Skill (choice if tied) receives +1 bonus
10-19Relic of Skill ExpertiseYour highest Skill (choice if tied) receives +1 bonus
20Relic of Skill AscensionBoth lowest and highest Skills receive +1 bonus
#### Permanence During the Sleep Phase, exchange 50 Gloom Gems with the Herald to prevent ever having to roll again. The benefits become permanent.

Destruction: The owner can destroy this Relic at any time and gain 50 Gloom Gems (or 75 Gloom Gems if it has Permanence).

Locations.Frost Peak Academy Faculty:
Frost Peak Academy Faculty

Dr. Alice Walker (Principal)

An extremely beautiful and refined woman in her late 30s. Many students consider her detached and calculating, running the academy with the efficiency of a production line. She is a logical thinker and extremely stubborn once she has come to a conclusion. Works closely with Chancellor Otomo of Blackmote University and fast-tracks her best students to the prestigious college. Maintains that students learn best in a sterile, clean environment; her office always smells of bleach and rubbing alcohol. Holds a doctorate in Psychology from Blackmote University.

Mr. Johnny Davenroy (English Teacher)

Only in his second year of teaching and in his mid-20s, Mr. Davenroy is the most laid back of the teachers, though cunning and irresistibly charming. Frequently relies on these skills to escape fallout from Principal Walker, who loathes his methods but cannot deny his students' testing results. Likely the most friendly and relatable teacher, easily balancing "mentor and confidant" with many students. Has a smoking problem he tries to keep under wraps.

Ms. Christina Accord (History Teacher)

An attractive and intelligent woman in her 30s who has earned the nickname "The Terror of Frost Peak" for being incredibly short-tempered and intimidating. However, insightful students have caught on that this demeanor is a facade to make trouble-making students transfer out early. After the first month, she becomes more calm and approachable, though her high standards never lower. Loves wearing all black on testing days and teasing about "Hell Week."

Mr. Samuel Toussaint (Mathematics Teacher)

A stern and authoritative Haitian man in his early 40s. Standing at 6'4" and 220 lbs, with a hard-cut jawline from years in the military as a Training Sergeant. Expects nothing but the best and gives additional homework when class is not on-task. However, his worst-kept secret is his obsession with bubbles and plotting their circumference - a passion shared with Mr. MacMillian at Math Club.

Prof. Maxwell MacMillian (Science Teacher)

An elderly gentleman and scholar in his mid-70s whose mind remains sharp as ever. Pleasant and reserved, he was formerly Head Professor of Mathematics at Blackmote University. None know why he left such a prestigious position. Quiet-spoken and easy to get along with, often saying "Though very young, you are all truly my equals." However, only the brightest students understand his explanations. Extremely patient and willing to assign additional homework for "exercising the little gray cells."

Mr. Benjamin Becks (Fine Art / Music Teacher)

An excitable and eccentric adult in his early 20s who turned down an offer from a prestigious worldwide symphony to teach. Always has a smile and enthusiastic disposition, especially during music classes. Has learned an extremely wide variety of instruments with incredible skill. Very tall and skinny but well respected by musically-oriented students. Others may describe him as "overly energetic and cumbersomely cheerful."

Mr. Edgar Howard Applewood (Technology Teacher)

"Mr. H" is an eccentric and strange but handsome man with sharp features in his early 30s. Prefers the company of computers to people and often communicates worldwide with technology enthusiasts. Detached and methodical as a teacher, rarely showing emotion but prone to occasional bouts of excitable mania. Primarily dresses in black and subdued colors. When he chooses to speak, even Principal Walker takes his suggestions into careful consideration.

Ms. Zerenity Luminitza (Foreign Languages / Home Economics)

A well-educated and quiet woman in her early 30s. Was a foreign woman living abroad as manager of a small but successful traveling business until it was bought out. A renowned polyglot who fluently speaks nine languages with a master's degree in Linguistics. Demure and intelligent with few local friends, has a slight accent from her home country. Typically found enjoying literature at the local library. Has a keen but secret interest in the occult, divination, and esoteric knowledge.

Ms. Faith Solitario (P.E. / Health / Coach)

The only child of an immigrant family, Faith is a very attractive and physically fit woman in her late 20s. Her dreams of winning the first world cup for her national women's sports team were dashed by an unfortunate accident. Coped by throwing herself into teaching and assistant coaching with unmatched ferocity. At best, a no-nonsense, passionate woman who pushes students to their limits; at worst, hot-headed and arrogant. Replaced Coach Mark Bobanova after his sudden disappearance. Led the girl's basketball and boy's soccer teams to state victories.

Ms. Sally La'Fleur (Art / Drama / Jewelry)

An excitable, overworked lady in her late 30s powered solely by obscene amounts of coffee. Works at school while also owning Witch's Wardrobe costume shop. Her demeanor is a roller coaster from energetic and fast-talking to slumped and dismissive, dictated by her last cup of coffee. Has wild red hair, wide-circular glasses, and typically wears sweaters and long skirts. Her art taste is eclectic, focusing on obscure old painters and the backgrounds of artwork rather than focal areas.

Ms. Aria Tovey (School Counselor)

In her mid-20s and the newest addition to Frost Peak faculty. Has an eager desire to prove herself. Very little is known about her beyond her cheery disposition. Most who interact with her feel she is a beacon of sunshine and comfort where stress runs high. Her young, bubbly attitude can breathe new life into even the most despondent students, and her unique giggle is both adorable and infectious.

  • Restored by Refreshing Sleep Effect or certain Shards

  • Initiator must act first among participants

  • All participants pay full Unity Cost
  • Effects activate
